events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident on the highway involving a rear-end collision with another vehicle.
Claim assigned to Auto Accident category after reviewing the initial accident description and involved vehicle details.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to oversee the claim process and coordinate communication with the customer.
Customer received formal acknowledgment of the claim submission, reassuring them the insurance company is processing their case.
Request sent for police report, photos of damage, and driverâ€™s license copies to proceed with damage assessment.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including the police report and photos of the damaged car parts.
Investigation initiated to verify accident details, cross-check statements, and evaluate the extent of vehicle damages.
Investigation concluded confirming that the claimant was not at fault in the vehicle collision on the highway.
Proposed a settlement amount to cover the estimated repair costs of the vehicle including parts and labor.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer expressing satisfaction with the prompt claim handling.
Claim officially approved following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement and review of all documentation.
Payment was issued to the policyholder's bank account to cover the agreed vehicle repair expenses.
Claim was successfully closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the customer was satisfied with the resolution.
